header.h1: Everything You Need To Know During the Covid-19 State of Emergency

span.content: Everything You Need To Know During the Covid-19 State of Emergency

h5.strong: Get the Latest Info From the Town:

span.a: Sign up for CodeRED Community Alerts

li.span: Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

strong.span: The Red Cross will be holding a blood drive at The Reading Masonic Hall, 110 Haven Street on April 29, 2020 and May 27, 2020

strong.a: Select Board Approves Relief for Taxpayers

li.a: Reading issues Declaration of State of Emergency, Prohibits Door-to-Door solicitations, and more.

ul.li: State launches an online symptom evaluation tool. Check out Buoy Health here.

Mass. Department of Public Health issued a Stay-at-Home Advisory for Individuals over 70 and for those with underlying health conditions; and Safe Practices for the General Public. See this important and detailed information
Text COVIDMA to 888777 to sign up for the latest updates from the State to be texted to your phone
Governor orders all non-essential businesses to cease in-person operation through May 4, 2020. Press release.
Governor prohibits gatherings of more than 10 people, and all "athletic or recreational activities which bring people into close, physical contact." Press release. Assemblage guidance.

li.p: Massachusetts Public Schools closed to May 4, 2020 by order of the Baker Administration.

ul.li: Simple Recycling has temporarily suspended curbside pickup of pink recycling bags
All Town Playgrounds, Fields, and Athletic Courts Closed until further notice. Press Release.
No on-site service in bars and restaurants.
COVID-19 scams occuring - don't become a victim! See these tips from the Middlesex District Attorney's Office.
